The Huskies carry momentum into a Saturday rematch after beating the Rockets  on Friday at Victor E PERIOD Court

Khavon Thomas  Northern Star

The volleyball team celebrates after scoring a point against Toledo on Oct PERIOD  PERIOD

By  Carlos Finney Jr. Sports ReporterOctober  

DeKALB  The womens volleyball team took home a victory against the conference rival University of Toledo Rockets winning  in front of their home crowd Friday PERIOD

The first set got off to a backandforth start with a score of  early on PERIOD That trend continued as the two teams were attached to the hip midway through the match PERIOD

The two teams went toetotoe with neither looking to give an edge as the set would continue beyond game point with a score of  PERIOD The Huskies finally got two points separation on Toledo winning the set  and taking a  lead in the match PERIOD Junior outside hitter Katie Jablonski led the way with six kills PERIOD

Volleyball head coach Ray Gooden spoke on the very intense first set and how the Huskies were able to come away with a set win against a very competitive Toledo team PERIOD

We probably had four to five chances to win that first set and we still stayed patient Gooden said PERIOD We were able to handle the ball inside out and then we were able to take advantage of our opportunities to win that first set. the second set saw Toledo get off to an  lead PERIOD The Huskies battled their way back to even the score at  PERIOD From this point the two teams traded points until Toledo was able to take momentum and a three point lead to have a score of  PERIOD

The Huskies came back to tie the score once again near the end of the match making it  PERIOD Toledo took a one point lead but then the Huskies went on a  run to end the set to win with a score  to take a  set lead PERIOD

Jablonski led the way with eight kills followed by freshman middle blocker Charli Atiemo with four PERIOD Senior setter Grace Balensiefer did her part finishing the set with  assists PERIOD

In the third set Toledo took the lead to start once again  PERIOD Toledo built on this lead stretching it to five midway through the match with a score of  PERIOD

Toledo cut an NIU comeback short by winning the set  to force a fourth set PERIOD

In the fourth set it was dead even at  with both teams looking to take momentum PERIOD The Huskies were the team to do so going on a  run to take a lead of  PERIOD Toledo flipped the script by going on a  run during the set to tie the game at  PERIOD

Later on as the Huskies were in the middle of regaining control of the set a controversial pair of reviews by the officials took a point away from the Huskies and gave one to Toledo to make the score  instead of  that would have given the Huskies game point PERIOD

This did not stop the Huskies though as they won the next two points to win the set  and the match  PERIOD

The Huskies next game is against Toledo once again at  p.m PERIOD Saturday at Victor E PERIOD Court PERIOD
